snippet: Riot police fired brief rounds of tear gas on Tuesday night, but then retreated behind the presidential palace walls, apparently to avoid further clashes.
abstract: Riot police officers fire rounds of tear gas at tens of thousands of demonstrators outside presidential palace in Cairo protesting Islamist-backed draft constitution; clash is clearest evidence yet that new charter has widened divisions that have plagued Egypt since ouster of Pres Hosni Mubarak.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting from Cairo, and Peter Baker from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Riot police fired brief rounds of tear gas on Tuesday night, but then retreated behind the presidential palace walls, apparently to avoid further clashes.

headline.seo: Egyptians Protesting Draft Constitution Are Met With Tear Gas
headline.main: Thousands of Egyptians Protest Plan for Charter
headline.print_headline: Thousands Of Egyptians Protest Plan For Charter
